description: Impetigo is a highly contagious skin infection that is caused by bacteria. It is characterized by red sores that can break open and form a yellow-brown crust.
possible causes: Bacteria, such as Staphylococcus aureus or Streptococcus pyogenes, entering the skin through cuts, scrapes, or insect bites
Close contact with someone who has impetigo
symptoms: Red sores that may break open and ooze fluid
Yellow-brown crust that forms over the sores
treatments: Oral antibiotics for more severe cases
Keeping the affected area clean and covered
